I'm looking at the new Rule annotation in JUnit4. It's pretty nice, but it =
doesn't seem to inherit.

That is if I have a super class that has the @Rul=
e, sub class tests don't run the rule on its tests.

Combined with the requ=
irement that the rules field be public, this is surprising.

The practical =
effect for me is that it can't really replace my custom runner, as the @Run=
With annotation is inherited by subclasses.

Am I missing something?

Yisha=
i.
